addressleaf.section:
To
e right ho
n
ble my singuler good L.
e Earle of Essex.

De M
r
Bodley a M
r
le Comte d'Essex le mois de Janvier 1596

page.lettertext:
fol.120r
May it please yo
r
good L. I c
a
not rem
e
ber for matter of occurrence
at
we were ev
r
so barr
e
so long together. w
ch
makes me uprovided how
to answere as I would to yo
r
l
re
s of
e 29 of N
o
& 5 of De
c
in w
ch
e
poynt of submissi
o
of
e
Earle of Tyrone
was wonderfull wellcome
to those of this state: to whome I did import it, for
at
e good or
ill successe, of such af fayres of her
Ma
tie
may allso greatlie make or
marre in all
e acc
o
ns & doinges of those
t
waver in this c
o
trey.
By o
r
l
re
s out of
Germany,
e Cardinall of Austrich will be w
t
us verie shortlie: though they write fr
o
other places
t
he maketh
no such haste. But howsoev
r
I se noe cause to stand in feare
of his arrivall, if her Ma
tie
& this people persevere in a purpose
of mutuall support. For by all
t
I c
a
gather by gesse or by know-
ledge there is no jote of inclinati
o
, in
e prinicpall partes of
e bodie of this uni
o
, to runne any fortune of her th
e
hers,
or to sever or swarve in any cause what soev
r
, of weightie respect,
fr
o
her Ma
ties
courses. How I have bene busied to
swade w
th
M
r
Barnevelt
to give
e adventure once againe, in
e matter revi-
sed of my Ouverture of late, & what hath bene c
o
trived betwen
us about it, I have made a long rehersall unto my
L. Tre
s
wherin if we misse of
e marke whereat we ayme, we shall
likewise leese
e fruit of a great deall of travell: w
ch
if we had
bestowed wh
e
e time was fitter for it, ther was likelihood of
driving a farre better bargaine. But yet I live in good hope
of very good speed, w
t
e tidinges whereof together w
th
e notes of
e state of this contrye, w
ch
yo
r
L. did desire, & I have allwayes
had in minde, I trust to returne, before it be long.
And so
I take my humble leave. Fr
o
e Hage Ja
n
4 95
Yo
r
L. most humblie bounde Thomas Bodley./
